13.title: Celebrating Nan
13.plot: Ree mourns the loss of her mother-in-law by preparing a variety of dishes for the family based on her favorites meals and classic recipes.

1.title: Home on the Ranch
1.plot: Ree whips up chicken-fried steak with mashed potatoes and gravy, tomato salad and cowboy breakfast sandwiches.

2.title: Surprise Birthday
2.plot: Ree plans a surprise birthday party for her 7-year-old son, Todd Drummond. On the menu: lemon-blueberry pancakes; macaroni and cheese; and sliders with a toppings bar.

3.title: Cowgirls and Cowboys
3.plot: There's a battle of the sexes going down on the ranch where the guys like their food brown and hearty. Then when the guys are away, eating steak and potatoes, the girls will play.

4.title: The Drummond Bunch
4.plot: Prepared: spicy Cajun pasta; egg-in-a-hole; Oklahoma-style cherry limeade.

5.title: Frontier Family
5.plot: Pot roast, mashed potatoes and blackberry cobbler are served for Sunday dinner. Also: malted-milk-chocolate-chip cookies.

6.title: Rancher's Dinner
6.plot: Guns, roping and a marital shootout are at the Drummond's Rancher's dinner. This is party time with a real wild west difference.

7.title: Christmas
7.plot: The Drummond family celebrate Christmas on the ranch. Ree makes cinnamon rolls to give as gifts. Later, a festive feast is prepared. On the menu: prime rib with a rosemary-salt crust; Duchesse potatoes; nine-hour Burgundy mushrooms.

1.title: Ranching in the Mist
1.plot: Ree plans the night before for a cowboys and cowgirls lunch. She prepares spicy pulled pork; cilantro slaw; potatoes au gratin; a flat apple pie with homemade caramel sauce.

2.title: All Stocked Up
2.plot: Ree dips into her trusty staples, from her pantry and freezer, to whip up some fabulous food for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

3.title: The Big Game
3.plot: A football-party spread, featuring two styles of hot wings; guacamole; pico de gallo; and brownies.

4.title: Little School House on the Prairie
4.plot: School's in at the lodge where it's home-school Co-Op day. Snacks include strawberry oatmeal bars; make-ahead muffin melts; strawberry jam; broccoli-cheese soup in bread bowls.

5.title: Chocolate Day
5.plot: It's chocolate day at the lodge. Let the choc fest begin, with three chocolaty dishes. Also: a corn-and-cheese chowder recipe.

6.title: Camping at the Creek
6.plot: It's a big annual event on the Ranch, camping under canvass at the creek. Ree prepares foods that can be cooked over a campfire. Then, she whips us a romantic date-night menu for two at the ranch.

7.title: Potluck Sunday
7.plot: It's potluck Sunday at the church and comfort food to the max. On the menu: homemade meatballs; green-bean casserole; red-velvet sheet cake.

8.title: Ladd's Birthday
8.plot: It's Ladd's 43th birthday and Ree's conjuring up a fabulous birthday dinner, which includes chicken Parmesan, chocolate cake and blackberry ice cream.

9.title: Kidswap Sleepover
9.plot: Ree's swapping kids for a sleepover with her best friend Hyacinth.

10.title: Triple Act
10.plot: Ree's mom and sister are staying on the ranch for the weekend. They all prepare family recipes, including seafood pasta.

11.title: Rise and Shine
11.plot: It's the tale of three breakfasts on the ranch. They are scones, eggs Benedict and breakfast burritos.

12.title: Family Matters
12.plot: Ree's father and step-mom are coming to the ranch for dinner, featuring grilled steaks with homemade sauces, salads and sides.

13.title: PW to Go
13.plot: Meat loaf with a spicy-tomato topping, twice-baked new potatoes and pecan pie are on the menu.

1.title: Burnin' Down the Barn
1.plot: It's a hot day on the ranch with 2 barns to burn down and workers to feed. Chicken spaghetti is served, along with an apple-pecan-and-blue-cheese salad. Also: breakfast muffins; frozen pops.

2.title: All Work and Some Play
2.plot: A rancher's work is never done, and the crew needs some serious sustenance. Ranch chicken sandwiches, raspberry lemonade and glazed donuts are made.

3.title: Paige and Friends
3.plot: Ree holds a slumber party for Paige and her four very best friends. Baked cinnamon French toast, kid-friendly pasta salad, prairie 'sushi' and decorated hand cookies are made.

4.title: Eating for One
4.plot: The family's away so Ree can play. On the menu: gazpacho; pasta with pancetta and leeks; chile rellenos; and bruschetta.

5.title: Frontier Fiesta
5.plot: It's fiesta time, as Ree Drummond creates a truly classic Mexican feast, which includes tequila-lime chicken, refried black beans, Mexican rice casserole and mango margaritas.

6.title: Girl Time and Burger Time
6.plot: The cowboys are away and it's time for quality cowgirl time. Veggie-packed pasta primavera, bacon cheeseburgers and French fries are prepared.

7.title: Horsing Around
7.plot: It's time to saddle up for a big day of horse riding on the ranch. Sloppy joes, carrot cake and homemade granola bars are prepared.

8.title: Mike's Day Out
8.plot: Ree Drummond's brother, Mike, visits the ranch for the day. On the menu: enchiladas; garlic-cilantro rice; marshmallow-crispy treats; root-beer floats.

9.title: Alex's Birthday
9.plot: Ree Drummond's throwing a surprise 16th birthday party of Alex. On the menu: a breakfast of prune cake with buttermilk icing; and a dinner that includes New York-style chopped salad with an herb-ranch dressing, home-baked rosemary focaccia and flower pot desserts.

10.title: B.F.F.
10.plot: Ree has friends coming to the lodge for their high school reunion. Her make-ahead menu includes salsa w/cheese nachos; mushrooms stuffed w/sun-dried tomatoes; spicy lemon-garlic shrimp; an arugula-and-Parmesan salad; & raspberry tiramisu.

11.title: For Papa
11.plot: Ladd's father has been honored with an award so Ree is throwing a party. Rib-eye steak with onion-and-blue-cheese sauce, smashed potatoes, grilled corn with pasilla butter, and strawberry cake are on the menu.

12.title: Make Hay While the Sun Shines
12.plot: Hay season means the family is working around the clock. Ree prepares "monster" cookies; calzones with homemade marinara sauce; and sherbet made with cherries and pomegranates.

13.title: Family Favorites
13.plot: Ladd and the kids are shipping cattle and Ree's rustling up lunch, cooking a special dish for each member. Recipes include: Salisbury steak; fettuccine Alfredo; sweet peas and carrots; and chocolate-peanut-butter pie.

15.title: Thanksgiving
15.plot: Recipes for a Thanksgiving feast include a turkey that's brined overnight; cornbread dressing with sausage and apples; sweet-roasted-rosemary-acorn-squash wedges; cranberry sauce; and green beans with tomatoes.

16.title: Christmas Is Coming
16.plot: Food for the Christmas season is prepared, including rigatoni with meatballs to eat while trimming the tree. Also: bacon appetizers; and chocolate-mint brownie bites to leave out for Santa Claus.

3.title: Ranch Games
3.plot: Ree & Ladd Drummond know the family that plays together, stays together. On the menu: tomato brisket; onion strings; blanched broccoli with cheese sauce; and chocolate-chip-cookie-ice-cream sandwiches.

4.title: Sixteen Minute Meals
4.plot: Ree Drummond shows how to make dinner in just sixteen minutes. The meal includes chicken quesadillas; beef with snow peas; and chicken-Florentine pasta.

5.title: Ten Things I Love
5.plot: Ree's celebrating all the things that she loves on the ranch. Recipes include bacon-wrapped filet; fancy macaroni-and-cheese; white-wine spritzers; and cream-filled cupcakes.

6.title: Cowboy Tailgating
6.plot: The cowboys & kids have a long day so Ree Drummond has a hearty lunch. The menu includes beef lasagna; garlic-cheese bread and fried pies.

7.title: Special Delivery
7.plot: Ree Drummond has two special deliveries to make to ravenous cowboys. For breakfast, she prepares orange rolls and peppered bacon. For dinner, she makes a beef stew with root vegetables and creamy cheddar grits.

8.title: Beat the Clock
8.plot: Ree Drummond pulls out the stops as Butch and Julie come over for dinner. On the menu: patty melts with hot potatoes; and a quick-marinated salad of cherry tomatoes. Also: bananas Foster with ice cream.

9.title: Food and Football
9.plot: In the Drummond household, football reigns supreme. Ree prepares "everything cookies"; beef-and-bean burritos with "jumbo pico" salad; and "breakfast of champions" sandwiches.

10.title: Cowboy Lunch
10.plot: It's a big work day and Ree Drummond whips up a hearty cowboy lunch, which includes pan-fried pork chops served with a cheesy hash-brown casserole; Ree's "best green beans ever" recipe; and peach cobbler.

11.title: Sunday Brunch
11.plot: Three generations of the Drummond family are gathering at the lodge for a Sunday brunch. The menu includes baked glazed ham; drop biscuits and ham gravy; baked eggs in hash-brown cups; and zesty fruit salad with orange-vanilla syrup.

12.title: School Day
12.plot: It's a home school day and Ree Drummond's teacher and lunch lady. The menu includes muffins with vanilla butter; chicken and noodles; and chocolate-dipped peanut-butter s'mores.

13.title: Edna Mae's Birthday
13.plot: Ree Drummond surprises Ladd's grandmother with a beautiful care package for her 89th birthday. Recipes include roast chicken; cauliflower soup with toasted crackers; and a blueberry Italian cream cake.

14.title: The Sleepover Six
14.plot: Cousin sleepover. Dishes served include individual fruit pizzas; crispy chicken strips; and sweet-potato fries. Also: Ree prepares a "kickin' mayo" and a honey-mustard dip.

15.title: Investment Reunion Dinner
15.plot: Ree's investment club gathers for a 10-year reunion and she prepares Mexican food. On the menu: blackberry margaritas; chicken-tortilla soup; cheesy jalapeño cornbread; and a tres-leches cake.

1.title: Old Friends, New Friends
1.plot: Ree's throwing a welcome home dinner for friends moving back to town. The menu includes peppercorn-roasted beef tenderloin; roasted-garlic mashed potatoes; a 2-ingredient dish called "the bread". Also: a 4-layer chocolate-strawberry cake.

2.title: Pickup Picnic
2.plot: Ree Drummond's spreading out a pickup picnic for the family and cowboys. Included: spicy roasted chicken legs; a cowboy bacon-beans recipe; deviled eggs; and mocha brownies with frosting.

3.title: Feeding Cows, Feeding Cowboys
3.plot: The cowboys are feeding the calves and Ree Drummond's feeding the cowboys. Recipes include French breakfast puffs; French-dip sandwiches; and baked fudge.

4.title: The Building
4.plot: Ree Drummond's making boxed lunches, for a site meeting to look over building plans. Included: colossal club sandwiches; easy Greek salad; homemade black pepper potato chips; and chocolate white-chocolate chip cookies.

5.title: Fourth of July
5.plot: It's an Independence Day celebration in Drummond family style. Recipes include perfectly baked beans, a Caprese salad, steak and, for dessert, peach crisp with maple cream.

6.title: Five Girls and a Baby
6.plot: Ree Drummond and her mom friends celebrate the end of the school year. She prepares a summer-theme menu, which includes fresh herb pizza; chicken salad; cherry cheesecake shooters; and Bellini cocktails.

7.title: Time Tested
7.plot: Recipes that take less than 30 minutes are featured, including mini-meatballs sandwiches; penne ally Betsy; buffalo chicken salad with blue-cheese dressing; and easy green chile enchiladas.

8.title: Fill the Freezer
8.plot: Ree Drummond's filling up the freezer with make-ahead meals of family favorites. Included: sour cream-noodle bake; chicken potpies made with thyme pastry; and creamy carrot soup.

9.title: Simply the Best
9.plot: Ree Drummond shares her best recipes for classic comfort foods in the world. This meal includes tomato soup, grilled cheese, scrambled eggs and, for dessert, yogurt parfait.

10.title: Breakfast Delivery
10.plot: Ree Drummond's making a rib-sticking breakfast delivery to cattle workers. She prepares their favorites, including her best breakfast potatoes ever, spicy scrambled eggs, as well as black pepper-and-sage biscuits with sausage gravy.

11.title: Big House Clean Up
11.plot: It's a big day of cleaning up the homestead ending with a massive bonfire. An alfresco dinner consists of crispy fried chicken, a perfect potato salad, colorful coleslaw and individual key-lime pies.

12.title: Dear Pioneer Woman
12.plot: No time? No Problem. Ree Drummond's solving time saving quandaries with recipes for a quick-and-easy apple tart; speedy shrimp stir-fry; and a big steak salad with crispy onion strings.

13.title: Alex's 16th Birthday
13.plot: A surprise 16th birthday party is planned for Ree's daughter, Alex. Preparations include a pasta bar with grilled chicken and different sauces, including spaghetti, alfredo and pesto. For dessert, a chocolate chip-caramel ice cream sundae.

14.title: Building Pens
14.plot: While Ree's family build new pens on the ranch, she's preparing them a Mexican feast, including citrus-grilled pollo asado; cheesy refried beans; spicy chile con queso served with pico de gallo; and homemade lemonade.

1.title: Cowboy and Cowgirl Lunch
1.plot: Ree Drummond's making a stick-to-your-ribs lunch, for Josh and Alex, which includes supreme pizza burgers; a quick Italian salad; and frozen-fruit pops. Also: French-silk pie.

2.title: Cutting Down Cedars
2.plot: The guys are cutting down cedar trees and Ree's rustling up lunch, which includes rigatoni with chicken thighs, a salad-bar salad w/creamy Italian dressing, garlic-cheese breadsticks and, for desserts, chocolate-peanut-butter-cup cookies.

3.title: Moving Cattle
3.plot: It's a busy day on the ranch with the Drummond gang moving cattle. Ree's whipping up a rib-sticking lunch. There's refreshing Lemon Limeade and his and hers pizzas. For dessert, Ice Cream Pie with Easy Caramel Sauce.

4.title: Make Ahead Marvels
4.plot: It's make-ahead marvels on the ranch as Ree cooks proactively. She prepares a hot corn-chili dip for a teen pool party; she whips up beef sandwiches for a hungry ranch crew. Also: a meat sauce that can be used in a variety of dishes.

5.title: Sweet Deliveries
5.plot: It's desserts as Ree Drummond shares her treats in sweet deliveries. Prepared: marshmallow pops for a sleepover treat; lime-coconut-butter cookies; and a recipe for "chocolate devils".

6.title: Tex-Mex for Cowboys
6.plot: It's a frontier style Tex-Mex feast for the Drummond crew after a day working cattle. It's a pre-dawn start, so they'll be hungry. Ree Drummond's fixin' Chicken and Beef Fajitas, Fiesta Beans and Cinnamon Ice Cream.

7.title: Scrumptious 16-Minute Meals
7.plot: No time is no trouble for Ree Drummond as she whips up 3 super fast 16-minute meals. There's a chicken-taco salad for lunch, a quick and easy roasted red-pepper pasta for a home-alone meal and 6 varieties of French-bread pizzas.

8.title: Turkey Day Leftovers
8.plot: Thanksgiving leftovers are used in dishes that include a Panini, spring rolls and a turkey tetrazzini casserole. Also: Ree uses pumpkin smoothies as an incentive to get her kids to finish their clean-up chores.

9.title: Dinner for Dad
9.plot: Ree Drummond's home alone and throwing an impromptu dinner party for her Dad and Stepmom. She's making her dad's favorites including Steak Oscar, Mushroom Pilaf on the side and Pots De Creme with Brandy Whipped Cream for dessert.

10.title: Christmas Cocktail Party
10.plot: Ree has invited a crowd of friends and family over to Drummond Ranch, for a festive holiday get-together that she's putting together in no time at all. On the menu: beef tenderloin sandwiches; holiday roll-ups; shrimp-pineapple skewers; tortellini skewers; Christmas queso; smoked sausage in barbecue sauce; and peppermint fudge.

11.title: Bulk Buys
11.plot: Ree's hitting the road on a major bulk buy trip. On the grocery list: chicken thighs to turn into peach whiskey chicken; apples for homemade applesauce, apple pancakes and healthy breakfast muffins; briskets for pizza, tostados and nachos.

12.title: Football Camp
12.plot: Ree offers to make a picnic lunch for the 120 kids and coaches attending football camp. On the menu: hot roast beef sandwiches; spiced-up potato chips; fruit; and a special treat of chocolate spreads with three delicious toppings.

13.title: Make Ahead Potluck
13.plot: Ree prepares a make-ahead potluck, featuring meatballs, a layered salad and blackberry-cheesecake squares.

1.title: Us and Them
1.plot: It's a tale of two dinners at the Drummond Ranch -- one for the kids and one for the grownups. The kids are tucking into Baked Ziti, while Ree Drummond makes Rib-Eye Steaks With Cowboy Butter, Baked Potatoes with all the fixin's.

2.title: Shakespeare Movie Night
2.plot: Ree Drummond's daughter's hosting a movie night and Ree's making a Roman-inspired menu to go with Julius Caesar. Supreme Pizza Lasagna, Julius Caesar Salad and Neopolitan Ice Cream are perfect before a tale of Roman intrigue.

3.title: Lighten Up
3.plot: Ree keeps it healthy by cooking lighter recipes and making time for exercise. On the menu: a low-carb lettuce burger; a carb-buster breakfast featuring poached eggs; a stir-fry, for lunch, made with butternut squash and kale; a smoothie.

4.title: Cowboy Mike
4.plot: Ree's brother visits and she makes Mexican hot chocolate with marshmallows for toasting over the fire. Also: a breakfast, dubbed "Eggbert's Sunrisers", served with orange mini-muffins.

5.title: 16 Minute Meals Around the World
5.plot: Ree goes around the world with 16-minute meals, including a traditional curry soup of Indian origin; Thai beef with peppers; and, from Italy, chicken piccata and buttery lemon-parsley noodles.

6.title: B-Man
6.plot: Ree makes a special meal to enjoy with her son, Bryce. On the menu: Italian meatloaf; no-bake mac and four cheeses; a salad of leaves with a punchy dressing; slice-and-bake cookies; and sundaes.

7.title: Gathering Bulls
7.plot: On the menu: strawberry lemonade; scalloped potatoes and ham; lemony green beans; chocolate-pecan crispy treats.

8.title: Happy Birthday, Pa-Pa
8.plot: A Cajun surf-and-turf feast is prepared when the family gathers together to celebrate Ree's father-in-law's birthday. On the menu: rare beef tenderloin; juicy jumbo shrimp; mashed potatoes; garlic-butter dinner rolls; strawberry shortcake.

9.title: Filling Edna Mae's Freezer
9.plot: Ree is taking some food over to Ladd's grandmother. She makes waffles, lasagna roll-ups, potato soup and cheese toast.

10.title: Breakfast, Lunch and Cowboys
10.plot: Ree makes apple fritters with bacon and sausage for breakfast. For lunch, she prepares pulled pork, classic coleslaw, and quick-and-easy baked beans.

11.title: Essential Cooking Tools
11.plot: Ree goes shopping at a local kitchen store for cooking tools to give as a wedding present. She also makes Italian meatball soup, potato-leek pizza, orange brulee and a dish she calls "Skillet Cookie Sunday".

12.title: Spring Burning
12.plot: Ree grills up dinner for her family. On the menu: a chicken slider bar, potato bundles, corn served with bell-pepper butter, and blackberry pot pies with vanilla-bean ice cream.

13.title: Big Day at the Building
13.plot: A Tex-Mex lunch is prepared for the unveiling at the building Ree has been renovating. On the menu: chipotle-chicken chili; chili-cheese muffins; caramel brownies; and Mexican punch.

1.title: 16-Minute Meals: All Day Long
1.plot: Meals that take 16 minutes are prepared for breakfast, lunch and dinner in the Season 8 premiere. Included: a French toast recipe using croissants; a wrap made with grilled chicken and strawberry salad; Pawhuska cheese-steaks.

2.title: Takeout at Home
2.plot: Ree makes her own version of Chinese takeout. On the menu: cream-cheese wontons; sticky orange chicken; beef with broccoli; and stir-fried chow mein.

3.title: Engagement Dinner
3.plot: Food for an engagement party. On the menu: Brie-stuffed mushrooms; bacon-wrapped shrimp w/chili butter; prime rib w/horseradish sauce; whiskey glazed carrots; roasted asparagus, peas; chipotle-salted chocolate truffles; a tower of cupcakes.

4.title: Man Cave
4.plot: Preparations, for a man cave on the ranch, are made as Ree whips up a meal consisting of a ranch chicken-and-bacon Panini, steak fingers with gravy, a mini-chopped salad, and "crazy" brownies.

5.title: Pet Parade
5.plot: Ree and her basset hound are invited to a pet parade and potluck picnic in Tulsa. On the menu: roasted lemon chicken legs; Mexican macaroni salad; watermelon pico de gallo; and brown-sugar-oatmeal cookies.

6.title: Kitchen Confessional: Comfort Food
6.plot: Ree shares recipes for her favorite comfort food, including chicken and dumplings; quesadillas with shrimp and peppers; pasta with tomato-cream sauce; and cinnamon toast.

7.title: Hitting the Road
7.plot: Ree prepares food for the men of the house, before she and her daughters go away on a college tour. On the menu: a breakfast-burrito kit; pasta alla Ladd; chipotle-ranch dressing for raw veggies; and cookie-and-cream cups for dessert.

8.title: Outdoor Cookout, Indoor Grilling
8.plot: A poolside get-together, for Ree and her gal pals, features a menu consisting of oven-roasted barbecue chicken thighs; grilled vegetables with cilantro-yogurt dressing; spicy pasta salad; vanilla ice cream with peach syrup.

9.title: Working Calves at Tim's
9.plot: Ree prepares a cowboy-approved tailgate lunch. On the menu: spicy baby back ribs; twice-baked potato casserole; slow-cooked jalapeño corn; roasted green beans; fruity dump cakes for dessert.

10.title: 16 Minute Meals: Pasta Pronto
10.plot: Four fast pasta recipes, including chicken-mozzarella pasta; shrimp scampi; pasta puttanesca; quick shells and cheese.

11.title: One Thing Leads to Another
11.plot: Ree uses black beans in a variety of dishes, including mango guacamole, taco pizza, grilled veggie burritos, and burgers.

12.title: Sister Time
12.plot: Ree plans a fun girls' night of cooking and eating with her sister, Beth. On the menu: frittata; kale-citrus salad; mystery rolls; and lemon-lime pound cake.

13.title: Fence Work
13.plot: Ree prepares a Tex-Mex tailgate lunch, for those helping fix a fence. Included: she sets up a taco bar with beef, green chile con queso, chipotle salsa, and chili beans. Also: she makes her favorite sugar cookies and chilled blueberry lemonade.

1.title: Tasty Treats to Go
1.plot: Ree prepares tasty treats to share with the people she loves. Included: pumpkin-cinnamon rolls; baklava; shortbread cookies with a layer of white chocolate; chocolate-dipped strawberries.

2.title: Herbalicious
2.plot: Ree uses her homegrown herbs in dishes, including lemon-rosemary scones; French onion soup with fresh thyme; a panzanella salad packed with basil; and a minty raita with salted naan wedges.

3.title: Perfect Pies
3.plot: It's pie day on the ranch so Ree Drummond's baking up a storm. She starts with a crowd-pleasing Caramel Apple Pie and makes a Frozen Grasshopper Pie. There's Strawberry Pretzel Pie and Mini Blueberry Galettes.

4.title: The Secrets in the Sides
4.plot: Ree prepares side dishes for Thanksgiving, including a casserole made with wild rice and broccoli; "sweet soul 'taters"; dressing with Brussels sprouts and butternut squash; no-knead clover leaf rolls.

5.title: Office Warming Party
5.plot: The Drummonds throw a big party to celebrate their new office in town. Guests are treated to a shrimp cocktail bar with three sauces, including classic, avocado crema, and remoulade. The menu also features spicy Italian meatballs; bacon-wrapped dates; and sweet brownie pops.

6.title: Cowboy Christmas
6.plot: For the holidays, the Drummonds throw a big frontier-style dinner and dance party for the local Ranchers, Cowboys and their families. The potluck dinner offer gifts, roping contests, a live band and a glorious Christmas tree.

7.title: Healthy 16-Minute Meals
7.plot: Fast and healthy meals are on the menu, including a hummus wrap; ginger-steak salad; grilled nectarine salad; and spicy cauliflower stir-fry.

8.title: Souper Good
8.plot: Ree whips up four stunning soups, starting with the kid-favorite Hamburger Soup. Tomato Soup makes an incredible make-ahead freezer dish. Sausage, Potato and Kale Soup is a one-pot wonder and her Spinach Soup is liquid soul food.

9.title: Chicken in Bulk
9.plot: Ree buys chicken breasts in bulk and prepares a Cobb salad, skillet chicken lasagna, Thai lettuce wraps, and chicken rice soup.

10.title: Football, Football, Football
10.plot: Chicken nachos are prepared. Also: chocolate-chunk cookies; Bloody Mary chili; three-ingredient brownies.

11.title: Ladies Who Brunch
11.plot: Ree prepares brunch for three generations of Drummond women. On the menu: maple-oat-nut scones; cowgirl quiche; champagne oranges; homemade frozen mochas.

12.title: Kitchen Confessional: Chocolate
12.plot: Chocolate recipes are prepared, including Ladd's chocolate pie, chocolate message cookies, and a totally retro chocolate fondue. Also: Ree shares her passion for chocolate-covered potato chips.

13.title: Shipping Cattle
13.plot: Ree prepares breakfast, which includes a pancake bar with oven-fried bacon, sweet strawberries, and other fun toppings. Later, for dinner, braised short ribs and cheese grits are on the menu.

14.title: Stacking the Hay and Stocking the Freezer
14.plot: Ree stocks the freezer with her family's favorite dishes, including chicken enchiladas, pizza pockets, three-cheese stuffed shells with tomato sauce, and frozen purple smoothie pops.

1.title: Speedy Sweets
1.plot: Desserts that are quick to make are featured, including white-chocolate pudding, a raspberry fool, a kid-pleasing sweet Panini recipe, and homemade caramel-apple sauce for sundaes.

2.title: Easter Weekend
2.plot: Easter is celebrated on the ranch with hot cross buns, tortellini primavera, crudités with a spinach dip and crispy eggs.

3.title: Freezer Fundamentals
3.plot: Ree demonstrates some of her favorite things to make-ahead and freeze. Included: all-purpose meatballs; grilled chicken and apricot panini; and spicy arrabbiata sauce.

4.title: Kitchen Confessional: Dinner Through the Decades
4.plot: Ree makes beef stroganoff, a favorite dish from her childhood; and shares a staple from her student days, when she prepares pasta ai Quattro formaggi. Also on the menu: crisp chicken nuggets; and coconut-curry shrimp.

5.title: Breakfast for Dinner
5.plot: Breakfast for dinner is the theme, when Ree prepares a sausage-kale strata; wild rice pancakes; quesadillas packed with bacon and eggs; and potato hash with a fried egg.

6.title: Friendship Fiesta
6.plot: A Tex-Mex feast includes marinated green-chile chicken; spicy taco potatoes; a layered Mexican salad; and key-lime pie.

7.title: Just Me and the Girls
7.plot: Ree prepares for a little "girl time", whipping up recipes for a blueberry-crumb cake; petite filets with wasabi-cilantro cream; a decadent lobster mac and cheese; and lemony broccolini.

8.title: Happy Birthday, Ladd
8.plot: A birthday dinner is prepared. On the menu: chili-cheese burgers; crispy thin fries; a wedge salad with Parmesan-peppercorn ranch dressing; and a towering yellow cake with chocolate-butter-cream frosting.

9.title: The Middles
9.plot: Ree celebrates her middle children, Paige Drummond and Bryce Drummond, by making their favorite dishes. Included: cornmeal pancakes with blueberry syrup; bowtie chicken Alfredo; and build-your-own grilled fruit pizzas with a cookie base and cream cheese frosting.

10.title: Perfecting the Pantry
10.plot: Recipes from Ree's pantry. Included: chickpea curry with rice; no-bake peanut butter bars; tapenade crustini; and seven-can soup.

11.title: Chuck and Crew
11.plot: Ree makes a Tex-Mex lunch for her father-in-law and his crew, who are fixing a fence on the ranch. On the menu: slow-cooked spicy shredded pork; cheese enchiladas; crunchy chipotle salad; and lemon bars.

12.title: Cooking, Feeding and Eating
12.plot: Hearty breakfast biscuits are prepared, along with three make-ahead meals. Included: Cajun brisket; cheesy sausage rigatoni; and something Ree calls "sleepin' in omelet".

13.title: Color, Color, Color
13.plot: The colors of summer are celebrated through recipes prepared by Ree. On the menu: Asian noodle salad; blueberry-nectarine crisp; strawberry ice cream; ginger-lemonade fizz.

1.title: Stanton and Paige
1.plot: Ree makes Chinese food for her daughter Paige's slumber party. On the menu: cashew chicken; edamame fried rice; and quick pan-fried kale. Also: a breakfast of strawberry-granola pancakes.

2.title: Graduation Party
2.plot: Ree throws a graduation party for Alex. Among the highlights is a taco bar with steak, shrimp, sides and toppings, including Tex-Mex black beans, queso blanco, peach salsa and roasted chili salsa.

3.title: Fired Up
3.plot: A Tex-Mex feast is prepared. On the menu: a chicken-tortilla casserole with homemade enchilada sauce; a fiesta tomato wedge salad; and Mexican fruit cocktail with sweet lime yogurt.

4.title: Packaged with Love
4.plot: Ree makes a care package, which includes zucchini cake topped with a sweet cream cheese frosting, crispy seasoned crackers, an escalloped cabbage casserole with a cheesy sauce and honey-glazed ham.

5.title: Surprise!
5.plot: A surprise birthday party lunch, for Todd, features cheesy smashed burgers with beer-battered onion strings and kicked-up fry sauce. Also: a 6-foot sundae, made with dark chocolate brownies, is served for dessert.

6.title: Perfect Picnic
6.plot: Ree throws a prairie picnic for her friends. On the menu: chicken Milanese with a topping of arugula and Parmesan; Mediterranean orzo salad; cold roasted veggies with herby yogurt dip; and pina colada tres leches cakes.

7.title: 16-Minute Meals: Cowboy Style
7.plot: Ree makes Tex-Mex fried rice and cowboy chopped salad for lunch; and for dinner, it's smothered pork chops with smashed red potatoes and sliced tomatoes on the menu.

8.title: Kitchen Confessional: The Other Men in My Life
8.plot: Ree prepares sweets for the men in her life. Included: a Bartlesville cream pie for her chocoholic dad; sweet-and-sour lollipops for her brother-in-law; lemon bread pudding with bourbon whipped cream for her father-in-law; crispy treats for her brother, Mike.

9.title: Shipping Season
9.plot: Lunch is made for Ree's hardworking family. Included: spicy sausage dogs in a curry-and-onion sauce; coleslaw with mustard-and-horseradish dressing; and kiwi-lime pie.

10.title: First Time for Everything
10.plot: Ree prepares some new dishes, including falafel with chipotle-tahini dip served on a pita; chicken and waffles with a decadent sauce made with maple syrup and bourbon; an easy upside-down tarte tatin.

11.title: Alex's Care Pack
11.plot: Ree makes a care package for her college-age daughter. On the menu: brownie cookies; homemade cheddar crackers; spicy party mix; and crazy chocolate bark.

12.title: Alone Again
12.plot: With the house to herself, Ree decides to make her favorite foods, including creamy oatmeal with crisp caramel and fresh berries for breakfast. A dinner menu consists of lamb chops with mint; green beans with lemon and blue cheese; baked sweet potato with cream and mint; boozy dulce de leche coffee.

13.title: Cousins Campout
13.plot: Food for a reunion campout with cousins. On the menu: cheesy bacon hot dogs; quesadillas over the campfire; sangria; and a cone bar full of treats, including Ree's homemade "crazy" cookies.

21.title: Pioneer Woman's Ultimate Thanksgiving
21.plot: Ree Drummond hosts a three-day countdown to a frontier-style Thanksgiving dinner. Make-ahead dishes include maple-whiskey turkey; very berry cranberry sauce; Parker House rolls; mashed potatoes with shallots; herbed cornbread for Southern dressing; Brussel sprouts; pumpkin gingersnap cheesecake with salted caramel sauce.

1.title: Dorm Room Dining
1.plot: In the Season 12 premiere, Ree offers ingenious ideas for dorm food. Included: waffle-maker pizza, panini and quesadillas; Caesar and fruit salads in a bag; chocolate cake in a mug; and tea kettle noodle soup.

2.title: Party in the Fridge
2.plot: Make-ahead dishes for a cocktail party. Included: chicken satay with peanut sauce; spinach-artichoke dip with salted pita wedges; caprese skewers with a balsamic drizzle; and honeydew spritzers.

3.title: Christmas Goodies
3.plot: Ree makes holiday goodies to give as gifts. Included: Christmas cherries cookies; Christmas cake cookies; homemade gumdrops; pretzel turtles; cayenne-cheese straws; sweet, spicy and smoky roasted almonds.

4.title: Anniversary
4.plot: Ree celebrates her wedding anniversary by cooking a special meal for her entire family. On the menu: prime rib for five with chimichurri sauce; Colorado wedge salad with buttermilk dressing; crispy Hasselbeck potatoes; and rustic country bread with honey butter.

5.title: Meatless Marvels
5.plot: Meatless meals are made. Included: broccoli-cheese baked potatoes; Greek grilled eggplant steaks and roasted vegetable panzanella; Italian cornbread; and tofu lettuce wraps.

6.title: Hay Day
6.plot: Ree makes dinner for her family after a long, sweltering afternoon of hauling hay at her brother-in-law's house. On the menu is spicy Slow-Cooked Ribs, cheesy Hominy Casserole, Broccoli Salad and Ice Cream Layer Cake.

7.title: Simple Meals
7.plot: Meals that are simple to make include a chicken-fennel bake; spaghetti carbonara; eggs in tomatoes; and veggie-tortellini soup. Also: Ree demonstrates three varieties of sheet-pan suppers, when she cooks sausage, Spanish-baked salmon, and teriyaki pork.

8.title: For Pete's Sake
8.plot: A Tex-Mex dinner is prepared. On the menu: carnitas; mango salad; cheesy refried bean casserole; spicy guacamole.

9.title: Double Game Day
9.plot: Food for a football-theme party. Included: kicked-up spicy wings with a cool blue cheese dip; quick chili; make-ahead sandwich rolls; a potato skins bar; salted pretzel brownies.

10.title: Special Day
10.plot: Kid-friendly treats for a late-afternoon picnic. Included: animal crackers; crunchy cereal chicken fingers; cucumber finger sandwiches; salad on a stick; and watermelon mini wedges.

11.title: Four Shades of Chocolate
11.plot: Decadent chocolate treats are prepared by Ree. On the menu: white chocolate raspberry cheesecake; dipped and decorated waffle cones; milk chocolate mousse; and a chocolate-orange martini.

12.title: Kitchen Confessional: Four Seasons on the Ranch
12.plot: Ree makes seasonal recipes. Included: a red wine pot roast for winter; a salad of roasted beet and goat cheese for spring; grilled chicken tacos with strawberry salsa for summer; and carrot-and-squash curry soup for fall.

13.title: Feeding 101
13.plot: Three make-ahead meals, including chicken Cordon Bleu casserole; Tex-Mex tamale pie with a spicy beef filling; and a big pan of hearty bean-and-bacon soup.

1.title: Oh, Baby
1.plot: Ree prepares a new-mom care package. Recipes include brisket; funeral potatoes; angel food cake with buttercream frosting; fruit salad with spiced honey and thyme; and sweet almond crackers.

2.title: A Tale of Four Lunches
2.plot: Lunch recipes are featured. On the menu: a spicy burger piled high with onion rings for Ree's father-in-law; a sesame-tofu salad; a hearty pan of hot Hawaiian beef sandwiches; and mango-chili chicken.

3.title: FAQ
3.plot: Ree hosts a viewer Q and A session starring a Slow Cooker Mexican Soup and a Killer Kale Salad. More cooking problems are solved with her Mom's White Bread and Ree gets the third degree on time, family and her four-legged friends.

4.title: Market Meet-Up
4.plot: Ree hosts a dinner for girlfriends who helped her stock her new store. She starts with quinoa salad with buttery roast vegetables, then serves Cheesy Cauliflower Soup with chunks of gooey Jalapeno Cheese Bread. Dessert is Salted Caramel Cheesecake Squares.

5.title: Tequila
5.plot: Ree uses tequila when cooking a meal. Recipes include queso fundido con tequila; shrimp-tortilla soup; berries with tequila cream; and a spicy Tequila Sunrise cocktail.

6.title: Mom's Day
6.plot: It's a fun day of treats for Ree. After she makes Italian Chicken Soup for lunch and Cherry Pie to set aside for dessert, Ree lets Ladd and the kids make a dinner of Filet Steaks, Oven Potatoes and Roasted Asparagus.

7.title: Kit and Caboodle
7.plot: Ree prepares four get-ahead meal kits. Included: barbecue chicken pizza with spicy slaw; veggie stir fry; spinach Alfredo pasta bake; stuffed bell peppers.

8.title: Burning 101
8.plot: Springtime recipes include spicy jerk chicken; and steak and bean burritos. Also: crunchy corn salad; grilled peaches and pineapples over ice cream.

9.title: Deli Food Showdown
9.plot: Ree tests recipes for her deli menu. Included: basic chicken salad with grapes vs. a curried chicken salad with raisins; Brie-and-broccoli quiche vs. corned-beef-and-cabbage quiche; and a plain, perfect breading pudding vs. a fancy version with whiskey cream sauce.

10.title: Fixin' Fence, Fixin' Lunch
10.plot: While Ladd and Cowboy Tim are out fixing fences, Ree Drummond prepares them their favorite Tex-Mex lunch. On the menu: grilled steak for rib eye quesadillas; spicy perfect pinto beans; and a taco ranch side salad. For dessert, skillet apple crisp.

11.title: Well Done, Dad
11.plot: Ree makes a special meal of her father's favorite foods, in celebration of his retirement from medicine. On the menu: slow-cooked Burgundy beef stew; creamy cheese grits casserole; blistered green beans with a surprise ingredient; and mini-chocolate cherry Bundt cakes.

12.title: 16-Minute Meals: Summer
12.plot: Four summery 16-minute meals are prepared. On the menu: cilantro lime salmon; a Greek feast to go with Mediterranean chicken skewers, crunchy salad, red pepper hummus and olives; perfect pasta with pesto and peas for a mother-daughter dinner; and zucchini noodles fondue.

13.title: Chicken, Chicken, Chicken
13.plot: Ree Drummond cooks up a whole lot of chicken. She demonstrates the benefits of bulk buying with three fantastic dishes, including a slow cooker recipe; chicken pie; and chicken with kale Caesar salad.

1.title: Afternoon Tea
1.plot: An afternoon tea for Ree and her daughter. On the menu: fancy hot chocolate; ham-and-leek mini quiches; garden spread finger sandwiches; lemon-raspberry tarts; and mini-donut muffins.

2.title: Boxing Boys
2.plot: Ree prepares recipes for fruity granola chocolate chip cookies; Italian sloppy joes served with garlic toast; and lemon meringue pie.

3.title: Merc Deliveries
3.plot: Spicy fried chicken sandwiches, piled high with crunchy coleslaw, are prepared by Ree for the guys working on renovating her mercantile store and deli. Other recipes include salmon and veggie grain bowl; blondies; and a special snack mix.

4.title: Night on the Town
4.plot: Ree prepares dinner for her kids, before she heads out on the town with Ladd. On the menu: a mini meatballs pasta bake; make-your-own salad with Caesar ranch dressing; and mixed berry shortcakes.

5.title: Low Carb Lusciousness
5.plot: Low carb recipes are featured, including grilled pork tenderloin with baby bok choy; pizza with cauliflower crust and spicy sauce; and roasted shrimp with cherry tomatoes served alongside roasted lemon-chile broccoli.

6.title: Birthday Bash
6.plot: Ree plans a joint birthday bash for her son Todd and his cousin Caleb. The menu includes spicy pulled pork sliders; make-ahead slow cooker baked beans; and a three-layer homemade confetti cake.

7.title: The Couple That Cooks Together
7.plot: Ree cooks dinner with her husband, Ladd. On the menu: jumbo fried shrimp with a simple cocktail sauce; golden, spicy, curly fries; a speedy grilled corn casserole; and Mexican chocolate sundaes with cinnamon hot fudge sauce.

8.title: Mash Up Mania
8.plot: A mash-up theme. Recipes include chicken enchilasagna for dinner; a combo of zucchini bread waffles with cream cheese syrup for breakfast; potato chip and chocolate chip cookies; and a cheeseburger salad.

9.title: Deli Deliberation
9.plot: Ree Drummond seeks cowboy approval for dishes on her deli menu. Test recipes include rival chicken fried steaks paired with creamy gravy; classic biscuits vs. bacon and onion biscuits; and two versions of chocolate pie.

10.title: FAQ Freezer
10.plot: Featuring freezer cooking FAQs. Included: one dough to make both chocolate chip cookies and cherry and lime treats. Also: recipes for butternut squash soup; spicy chicken spaghetti; and a roasted tomatillo sauce.

11.title: Crazy-Sweet Treats
11.plot: Super s'mores and stunning marbled, dipped apples; deep-fried cheesecake bites with strawberry sauce; hard candy shot glasses topped up with fizz.

12.title: Good Ol' Days
12.plot: Ree Drummond cooks a lunch of steak and eggs Benedict on garlic butter English muffins, while her husband and his father dismantle an old cattle feed storehouse; Ree serves a pitcher of Chuck's cherry limeade and a pineapple upside-down cake.

13.title: Frontier Friendsgiving
13.plot: Ree Drummond celebrates a frontier-style friendsgiving celebration with friends; turkey roulade rolled around sausage stuffing; leek and potato casserole as a mashed potato substitute; adventurous sides; pomegranate cocktail.

14.title: The Eleventh Hour
14.plot: Ree Drummond thanks the crew helping to open her store; juicy Asian beef skewers; retro ham salad in endive cups; a no-cook salami platter; decadent black and white brownies; chewy caramel nut truffles; Pawhuska prohibition punch.

15.title: Never Enough Puff
15.plot: Ree Drummond shares her top five favorite puffed pastry recipes; cheese straws and sausage parmesan palmiers; individual beef pot pies; puff pastry pizza; Ree's marvelous Mille Feuille.

16.title: Christmas Unwrapped
16.plot: Ree Drummond shares a trio of fast, fabulous bites; grilled chicken skewers; fig and goat cheese bruschetta; no-cook cheesy mini peppers; chocolate candy cane cookies are left out for Santa; Yorkshire pudding; mulled apple cider.

1.title: Lighter 16-Minute Meals
1.plot: Ree Drummond turns four of her favorite recipes into lighter, healthier 16-minute meals; a quick chicken Parmesan for the kids' dinner; lighter Asian noodle salad; tasty taco skillet; fried pork chops with white beans and spinach.

2.title: B-Man and Me
2.plot: Ree Drummond spends some quality time with her son, Bryce Drummond, by making him beef fajita nachos; slow cooker white chicken chili; orange-vanilla monkey bread; meat and potato scramble.

3.title: Other Cuts of Beef
3.plot: Ree Drummond uses random cuts of beef; slow cooker Sunday stew with buttery parsley lemon noodles; bottom round steak in a teriyaki beef stir fry; ground beef in meat pies; top round London broil in a grilled beef salad.

4.title: Truly Madly Crazy
4.plot: Ree Drummond cooks up game night food; pull-apart pizza rolls; Hawaiian burgers with grilled pineapple; taco quesadillas; husky bark inspired by Coach Ladd and the team colors.

5.title: Merc Story
5.plot: Ree Drummond shares the story of opening her store, The Mercantile, while making three get-ahead dinners; butternut mac and cheese; Tuscan bean soup; ready-to-go chili packets for chili dogs; chili nachos and chili cheeseburgers.

6.title: Sharing Chocolate
6.plot: Ree Drummond prepares a triple chocolate tiramisu as a thank-you to her best friend; chocolate butterscotch caramel bars; crispy chocolate dippers for a crazy chocolate shake.

7.title: Kit for Cowboy Cameron
7.plot: Ree welcomes Cowboy Cameron to the ranch with a frontier-style dinner kit of his favorite food; short rib sandwiches; roasted butternut squash salad; salted caramel frosted brownies; sweet tea lemonade.

8.title: Old-Fashioned Comfort
8.plot: Ree Drummond prepares old-fashioned comfort foods; tuna noodle casserole; meatballs in sweet and sour sauce; glazed apple dumplings; cheesy Welsh rarebit.

9.title: Lunches to Go
9.plot: Ree Drummond prepares three lunches; beef noodle salad bowls with peanut sauce; a cowboy bento box packed with chicken wings in homemade BBQ sauce, creamy lemon basil potato salad, and apple and celery slaw; kale pasta mason jar salad.

10.title: Dinner's All Done
10.plot: Ree Drummond comes home to find dinner ready; shepherd's pie made from a hearty beef stew with beer and paprika, covered in a thick layer of horseradish mashed potatoes; roasted carrots with vinaigrette; raspberry cream pie.

11.title: 16-Minute Meals: Family Favorites
11.plot: Family favorite 16-minute meals; chicken mozzarella pasta; cowboy chopped salad; French bread pizza with six different toppings; beef with snow peas stir-fry.

12.title: Breakfast "Eggstravaganza"
12.plot: Ree Drummond serves up different types of eggs for breakfast; eggs benedict; steak and eggs benedict with spicy hollandaise; the best scrambled eggs ever pioneer-style; cornmeal pancakes with blueberry syrup; eggs in tomatoes; spicy eggs on toast.

13.title: Spring Is Sprung
13.plot: Ree Drummond cooks up seasonal glazed baked ham for a Sunday brunch; wrapping up spring cleaning with fried chicken and a bonfire; pasta primavera and Mexican fruit cocktail with sweet lime yogurt.

1.title: All in One
1.plot: Ree Drummond makes non-stop all-in-one wonders; chicken and dressing sheet pan supper; lemon, basil and shrimp risotto in a skillet; ramen pho; layered portable Greek salad in a jar.

2.title: All in a Morning's Work
2.plot: Ree Drummond fixes up a warming lunch; chunky beef chili; a cowboy favorite with two kinds of beef; cheesy quesadilla; individual caramel cakes.

3.title: Just for Kicks
3.plot: Ree Drummond makes spicy food; Kung Pao chicken; spicy srirachi popcorn; new queso; spicy cowgirl coffee; spicy shrimp.

4.title: 16 Minute Dinners
4.plot: Evening meals in Ree Drummond's 16-minute frontier fast lane; shrimp tacos with slaw and fixings; pork chops with wine and garlic with a side of zesty lemony green beans; pepperoni chicken; crispy grilled cheese.

5.title: Drummond Kids at the Merc
5.plot: Filling the fridge with the kids' favorite foods; Paige's quiche with her pick of fillings; broccoli cheese mac and cheese mash-up as ordered by Bryce; chicken noodle soup for the Merc's newest recruit; berry yogurt parfaits.

6.title: Breakfast Hacks
6.plot: Ree is testing delicious ideas for kitchen hacks to up her breakfast game, including a shortcut to Chocolate Chip Hazelnut Pancakes; she creates a crazy Omelet in a Bag; unleashes the waffle iron for cheesy hacked Wafflemaker Hash Browns.

7.title: Cleaning Out the Fridge
7.plot: Ree cleans out her fridge and uses up food that's on the way out; she creates a lemon rice pudding with left-over lemons; the produce drawer is transformed into a Fridge Gazpacho; she creates marinade for grilled Tex Mex Chicken and Chicken Alfredo.

8.title: Elevate This
8.plot: A ready-made angel food cake becomes Baked Alaska; a package of cookie dough transforms into Fruit Tarts; a round white loaf makes a Roasted Garlic Four Cheese Pull-Apart Bread; a can of tomato soup becomes Tomato Soup 2.0.

9.title: Competing Breakfasts
9.plot: Ree Drummond tries to win back her husband; she makes the Farmer's Breakfast, with over-easy fried eggs, honey-glazed ham, fried sausage and bacon, plus crispy bits potatoes and sticky buns: Ree versus her own restaurant.

10.title: The Way Things Used to Be
10.plot: Ladd and his father look forward to a slap-up cowboy spread; Ree makes a PW steak rub to sprinkle over breakfast steaks; side dish: breakfast grits with bacon and jalapenos; a can of Ree's mom's classic apple dumplings.

11.title: Ranch-Style Tex Mex
11.plot: Cooking up ranch style Tex Mex Cheese Enchiladas for her father-in-law and his team; Individual Pina Coladas Tres Leches Cakes; simple, perfect Chili to warm up Ladd and the kids; Mango and Virgin Margaritas for cocktail hour.

12.title: Summer Summer Summer
12.plot: A collection of summertime recipes from over the years; a shortcut ice cream pie with easy caramel sauce; a panzanella makes a go-to summer salad; gazpacho with juicy shrimp; turning juicy berries into strawberry salsa for grilled chicken tacos.

13.title: Breakfast on the Run
13.plot: Breakfast cookies are a perfect jump start on the morning; a bountiful bento box for Paige with Amish baked oatmeal, mini fruit kebabs with blueberry yogurt dip and individual ham casseroles; full-on fun apple granola stackers.

14.title: Driving Fence Posts
14.plot: The Drummond family tackles a big fence post project on the ranch; strip steak sandwiches with grilled onions and over easy eggs; cowboy dippers with a delicious buttermilk dip; shortcut mini pecan pies and frozen summer coolers.

15.title: Alex Is Home!
15.plot: Alex is home from college and the cousins get together for a street taco feast; Texas braised beef; ranch chicken to pile into tacos; avocado lime crema; salsa diablo; mango de gallo; brown beans; grilled mini peppers; purple paletas.

20.title: 16-Minute Meals: On Standby
20.plot: Ree Drummond shares four favorite 16-minute standby meals; Thai beef with peppers and an incredibly quick and easy roasted red pepper pasta; heavenly hummus wraps; apple peanut butter delights.

21.title: Kids in the Kitchen
21.plot: The Drummond kids are in the kitchen for a fun collection of culinary collaborations; Paige and Bryce get creative with make your own grilled fruit pizza; a strawberry shortcake cake; mother-daughter reboot of the cutest marshmallow pops.

1.title: Grilling to Go
1.plot: Ree Drummond grills a well-deserved tailgate lunch after a busy day with the ranch calves. The menu includes Cheesy Steakburgers, spicy Street Corn and sweet Blueberry Hand Pies.

2.title: Hay There!
2.plot: Strawberry cherry lemon limeade and awesome orange bars; a great make-ahead dinner on the go with slow-cooker lasagna and Missy's marinated tomatoes, ready to eat when the family's done stacking hay.

3.title: Care Package 101
3.plot: The fundamentals of care packages; lemon and raspberry pound cake; snicker-doodles; brown butter granola clusters; strawberry fruit roll-ups; custom-made hot chocolate mixes.

4.title: Pizza Ree-boot
4.plot: Mini cauliflower pizzas; herbed chicken Caesar salad pizza; marsala mushroom and goat cheese flatbreads; watermelon pizza that takes sweet pizza to a whole new level.

5.title: Nothing But the Best
5.plot: Stuffed pizza crust with arrabiata sauce; orange blueberry muffin tops; a little fruit with my crisp; crispy chicken skins; incredible CLT salad with simple ranch dressing.

6.title: Sunday At Chuck and Nan's
6.plot: Ladd's dad grills his famous chicken a la Chuck, while the family's at church; deviled bacon and eggs; a big pot of pork lovers' baked beans; a country-style peach slab pie.

7.title: Thanksgiving Shortcuts
7.plot: Thanksgiving turkey gets cooked and portioned out in advance; doctored-up dressing and gussied-up gravy; roasted sprouts and onions; spiked cranberry sauce and herby butter dinner rolls; chocolate marshmallow pumpkin pie;

8.title: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Freezer!
8.plot: Crunchy French toast sticks; Tex-Mex butternut squash soup for ranch ladies that lunch; for dinner, it's casserole royalty, king ranch chicken; quick and easy confetti cups.

9.title: Things to Bring
9.plot: Ree Drummond shares four festive potluck party ideas for the Christmas cocktail party season; cheery cheesecake Santa hats; bruschetta bar to go; Mediterranean artichoke dip and mini bagel chips for a friend's party.

10.title: Cowboy Drive-Through
10.plot: Ree Drummond serves a packed lunch, known to cowboys, thru a drive-through; she prepares ranch hand sandwiches filled with pop-pulled pork and a bunch of tasty fixins; a side of homemade spicy sweet potato chips; a cup of refreshing cowboy fruit salad with a subtle chili kick triple-chocolate cow pies.

11.title: Brunch Is in The Fridge!
11.plot: Ree Drummond hosts brunch; she pulls together all the ingredients for an interactive and customized bloody Mary bar; she knocks out a marvelous make-ahead dinner mash-up of everyone's brunch favorites in her tater tot breakfast casserole.

12.title: Happy Birthday to Me
12.plot: It's Ree Drummond's birthday, and she's celebrating by making over some of her all-time recipes and road-testing them for social media. She starts with mini-turkey meatloaves, then remixes mac and cheese with cauliflower.

13.title: Shipping and Shopping
13.plot: Ree Drummond is shopping and sharing recipes for ground beef; the guys on the ranch ship cattle; slow cooker Bolognese; Southwest beef lettuce wraps and shortcut rye bread party pizzas.

31.title: One-Stop Thanksgiving
31.plot: A frontier-style Thanksgiving. Recipes include pumpkin gingersnap cheesecake with salted caramel sauce; broccoli wild rice casserole; no-knead clover leaf rolls; green beans and tomatoes; soul sweet taters; pumpkin smoothies; a toasty leftover Thanksgiving panini;

1.title: How the Cookie Crumbles
1.plot: Chocolate mint iced cookies decorated with swirls of snow white royal icing; browned butter sugar cookies that become the base for cookie jam pies; next-level chocolate chip cookies with bacon and caramel corn; no-bake cookies.

2.title: Waste Not, Want Not
2.plot: Ree reclaims kitchen scraps and transforms them into five-star dishes. Recipes include Roasted Potato Peels, Stir Fried Broccoli Stems, Overnight Chicken Broth, Crisper Cash Frittata and Leftover Fruit Bread.

-1.title: Episode dated 27 January 2018
-1.plot: Ree's cooking mega with big food for the big game. Recipes include her stacked Bodacious Burger, over-the-top Monster Meatballs, a Super-Sized Slice of Pizza and a mammoth Mile High Mud Pie.

imdb.title: The Pioneer Woman
plot: 'Ree Drummond' (qv), a city gal-turned-rancher's wife, creates down-home dishes on her picturesque Oklahoma ranch.::Erik Kirchner
